paper_abstract: New design-based ratio and difference estimators of the distribution function are defined by minimizing the mean square error of a class of estimators. Proposed estimators do not assume a superpopulation model between the variable of interest and the auxiliary variable. Results derived from simulation studies indicate that proposed estimators can be more accurate than existing estimators, especially when alternative estimators suffer from model misspecifications. (C) 2013 IMACS. Published by Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: New ratio and difference estimators of the finite population distribution function
